docs.title: goax
docs.text: Bash wrapper for goaccess to generate web statistics from nginx/apache access logs.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Easy setup: interactive configuration wizard
  • Multiple reports: all traffic, bots only, no bots
  • Navigation UI: index.html with menu to switch between reports
  • Bot detection: filters traffic by 20+ known bot user-agents
  • Protected output: setup password-protected stats folder
  • Cron-ready: designed for automated scheduled runs

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
# 1. Install
git clone https://github.com/pforret/goax.git
cd goax

# 2. Install goaccess
./goax.sh install

# 3. Configure
./goax.sh config

# 4. Generate reports
./goax.sh run

docs.title: Commands
docs.text: Command Description goax install Install goaccess (detects OS package manager) goax config Create configuration file interactively goax folder [user] Setup password-protected output folder goax run Generate HTML reports goax check Show current configuration

docs.title: Generated Reports
docs.text:
The run command creates 4 files in your output directory:

File Content index.html Navigation wrapper with menu bar all.html All traffic (bots + humans) nobots.html Human traffic only bots.html Bot traffic only

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Run goax config to create a goax.env file:

ACCESS_LOG="/var/log/nginx/access.log"
OUTPUT_DIR="/var/www/example.com/stats"
LOG_FORMAT="COMBINED"

Or use command-line options:

goax run -l /var/log/nginx/mysite.access.log -o /var/www/mysite/stats

docs.title: Bot Detection
docs.text:
The following user-agents are classified as bots:

  • Search engines: Googlebot, Bingbot, Yandex, Baidu, DuckDuckBot
  • SEO tools: Semrush, Ahrefs, Moz, MJ12bot, DotBot
  • AI crawlers: GPTBot, ClaudeBot, Bytespider
  • Social: FacebookExternalHit, TwitterBot, LinkedInBot, WhatsApp
  • Others: Applebot, PetalBot, and generic bot/crawler/spider patterns

docs.title: Cron Setup
docs.text:
For hourly reports:

0 * * * * /opt/goax/goax.sh run >> /var/log/goax.log 2>&1

docs.title: Installing goax on DigitalOcean
docs.text: Guide for Ubuntu droplets with Nginx.

docs.title: 1. Install goax
docs.text:
# Clone the repo
cd /opt
sudo git clone https://github.com/pforret/goax.git
sudo chmod +x /opt/goax/goax.sh

# Add to PATH (optional)
sudo ln -s /opt/goax/goax.sh /usr/local/bin/goax

docs.title: 2. Install goaccess
docs.text:
goax install
# or manually:
sudo apt update && sudo apt install goaccess -y

docs.title: 3. Configure
docs.text:
cd /opt/goax
goax config

Typical DigitalOcean values: 

ACCESS_LOG="/var/log/nginx/access.log"
OUTPUT_DIR="/var/www/html/stats"
LOG_FORMAT="COMBINED"

For multiple sites: 

ACCESS_LOG="/var/log/nginx/*access.log"

docs.title: 4. Setup protected folder
docs.text:
sudo goax folder statsadmin

Add to /etc/nginx/sites-available/default: 

location /stats {
    auth_basic "Statistics";
    auth_basic_user_file /etc/nginx/.htpasswd;
    alias /var/www/html/stats;
    index report.html;
}

Reload nginx: 

sudo nginx -t && sudo systemctl reload nginx

docs.title: 5. Generate first report
docs.text:
sudo goax run

View at: https://your-droplet-ip/stats/

docs.title: 6. Setup cron
docs.text:
sudo crontab -e

Add (hourly reports): 

0 * * * * /opt/goax/goax.sh run >> /var/log/goax.log 2>&1

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
Permission denied on log files: 

sudo usermod -aG adm $USER
# logout/login required

Nginx config test fails: 

sudo nginx -t

Check goaccess version: 

goaccess --version

docs.title: Installing goax on Ubuntu
docs.text: Tested on Ubuntu 20.04, 22.04, 24.04. Assumes web server (Nginx/Apache) is already running.

docs.title: 1. Prerequisites
docs.text:
sudo apt update
sudo apt install -y git apache2-utils

docs.title: 2. Install goax
docs.text:
cd /opt
sudo git clone https://github.com/pforret/goax.git
sudo chmod +x /opt/goax/goax.sh
sudo ln -s /opt/goax/goax.sh /usr/local/bin/goax

docs.title: 3. Install goaccess
docs.text:
# Standard repo (older version)
sudo apt install -y goaccess

# Or latest version from official repo
echo "deb https://deb.goaccess.io/ $(lsb_release -cs) main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/goaccess.list
wget -O - https://deb.goaccess.io/gnugpg.key | sudo apt-key add -
sudo apt update
sudo apt install -y goaccess

docs.title: 4. Configure
docs.text:
cd /opt/goax
goax config

Example for domain example.com:

Setting Value ACCESS_LOG /var/log/nginx/example.com.access.log OUTPUT_DIR /var/www/example.com/stats LOG_FORMAT COMBINED

docs.title: 5. Setup protected folder
docs.text:
sudo mkdir -p /var/www/example.com/stats
sudo goax folder statsadmin

docs.title: For Nginx
docs.text:
Edit your site config (e.g. /etc/nginx/sites-available/example.com): 

location /stats {
    auth_basic "Statistics";
    auth_basic_user_file /etc/nginx/.htpasswd;
    alias /var/www/example.com/stats;
    index report.html;
}


sudo nginx -t && sudo systemctl reload nginx

docs.title: For Apache
docs.text:
sudo a2enmod auth_basic

Create /var/www/example.com/stats/.htaccess: 

AuthType Basic
AuthName "Statistics"
AuthUserFile /etc/apache2/.htpasswd
Require valid-user


sudo systemctl reload apache2

docs.title: 6. Generate report
docs.text:
sudo goax run

View at: https://example.com/stats/

docs.title: 7. Setup cron
docs.text:
sudo crontab -e

0 * * * * /opt/goax/goax.sh run >> /var/log/goax.log 2>&1

docs.title: 8. Logrotate (optional)
docs.text:
Create /etc/logrotate.d/goax: 

/var/log/goax.log {
    weekly
    rotate 4
    compress
    missingok
    notifempty
}

docs.title: Installing goax on a VPS
docs.text: Generic guide for Linux VPS (Ubuntu, Debian, CentOS, etc.).

docs.title: 1. Install goax
docs.text:
cd /opt
sudo git clone https://github.com/pforret/goax.git
sudo chmod +x /opt/goax/goax.sh
sudo ln -s /opt/goax/goax.sh /usr/local/bin/goax

docs.title: 2. Install goaccess
docs.text:
goax install

Or manually per distro:

Distro Command Ubuntu/Debian sudo apt install goaccess CentOS/RHEL sudo yum install goaccess Fedora sudo dnf install goaccess Arch sudo pacman -S goaccess Alpine sudo apk add goaccess

docs.title: 3. Configure
docs.text:
cd /opt/goax
goax config

Common log locations:

Web server Log path Nginx (Debian) /var/log/nginx/access.log Nginx (CentOS) /var/log/nginx/access.log Apache (Debian) /var/log/apache2/access.log Apache (CentOS) /var/log/httpd/access_log

docs.title: 4. Setup protected folder
docs.text: sudo goax folder statsadmin

docs.title: Nginx config
docs.text:
Add to your server block: 

location /stats {
    auth_basic "Statistics";
    auth_basic_user_file /etc/nginx/.htpasswd;
    alias /var/www/stats;
    index report.html;
}

Reload: sudo systemctl reload nginx

docs.title: Apache config
docs.text:
Create /var/www/stats/.htaccess: 

AuthType Basic
AuthName "Statistics"
AuthUserFile /etc/apache2/.htpasswd
Require valid-user

Enable mod_auth: sudo a2enmod auth_basic

Reload: sudo systemctl reload apache2

docs.title: 5. Generate report
docs.text: sudo goax run

docs.title: 6. Setup cron
docs.text:
sudo crontab -e

# Hourly
0 * * * * /opt/goax/goax.sh run

# Daily at 3am
0 3 * * * /opt/goax/goax.sh run

# Every 15 minutes
*/15 * * * * /opt/goax/goax.sh run

docs.title: Permissions
docs.text:
If running as non-root user, add to adm group: 

sudo usermod -aG adm $USER

Or adjust log file permissions: 

sudo chmod 644 /var/log/nginx/access.log
